001package org.nasdanika.common;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.InputStream;
005import java.io.Reader;
006import java.lang.reflect.Array;
007import java.lang.reflect.Field;
008import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
009import java.net.URL;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011import java.util.Collection;
012import java.util.HashMap;
013import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Map;
016import java.util.Optional;
017import java.util.function.BiFunction;
018import java.util.function.Function;
019import java.util.function.Predicate;
020import java.util.regex.Matcher;
021import java.util.regex.Pattern;
022
023/**
024 * A generic source of contextual information keyed by a {@link String} - property, or a {@link Class} (type) - service. 
025 * @author Pavel
026 *
027 */
028public interface Context extends Composeable<Context> {
029        
030        /**
031         * Constant for base URI property.
032         */
033        String BASE_URI_PROPERTY = "base-uri";
034        
035        /**
036         * Empty context which can be used as a starting point
037         * for creating of composed/mounted contexts. 
038         */
039        static final Context EMPTY_CONTEXT = new Context() {
040                
041                /**
042                 * For types with static INSTANCE field of compatible type returns field value.
043                 */
044                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
045                @Override
046                public <T> T get(Class<T> type) {
047                        for (Field f: type.getFields()) {
048                                if ("INSTANCE".equals(f.getName()) && Modifier.isStatic(f.getModifiers()) && type.isAssignableFrom(f.getType())) {
049                                        try {
050                                                return (T) f.get(null);
051                                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
052                                                throw new NasdanikaException("Error accessing INSTANCE field of " + type.getName(), e);
053                                        }
054                                }
055                        }
056                        return null;
057                }
058                
059                @Override
060                public Object get(String key) {
061                        return null;
062                }
063                
064                /**
065                 * Returns this context if other is null or other context otherwise because there is no
066                 * reason to compose the empty context. A convenient method to get a non-null context.
067                 */
068                @Override
069                public Context compose(Context other) {
070                        return other == null ? this : other;
071                }
072                
073        };
074        
075        /**
076         * @param key Object key (property name).
077         * @return Property by a key.
078         */
079        Object get(String key);
080        
081        /**
082         * Convenience method for retrieving string properties.
083         * @param key
084         * @return
085         */
086        default String getString(String key) {
087                return get(key, String.class);
088        }
089        
090        /**
091         * Convenience method for retrieving string properties.
092         * @param key
093         * @param defaultValue
094         * @return
095         */
096        default String getString(String key, String defaultValue) {
097                return get(key, String.class, defaultValue);
098        }
099        
100        /**
101         * @param key Object key (property name).
102         * @param defaultValue value to return if key is not present.
103         * @return Property by key or default value if property is not present.
104         */
105        default Object get(String key, Object defaultValue) {
106                Object ret = get(key);
107                return ret == null ? defaultValue : ret;
108        }
109        
110        /**
111         * @param key Object key (property name).
112         * @param computer FunctionFactory to compute value if key is not present.
113         * @return Property by key of a value returned by the computer if property is not present.
114         */
115        default Object get(String key, Function<String,Object> computer) {
116                Object ret = get(key);
117                return ret == null ? computer.apply(key) : ret;         
118        }
119        
120        /**
121         * @param <T> Service type.
122         * @param type Service type class.
123         * @return Service of a particular type. Multiple service instances maybe obtained by passing an array type.
124         */
125        <T> T get(Class<T> type);
126        
127        /**
128         * @param <T> Service type.
129         * @param type Service type class.
130         * @param defaultService Default service implementation to return if no service is found. 
131         * @return Service of a particular type or default service if no service of requested type is found in the context. Multiple service instances maybe obtained by passing an array type.
132         */
133        default <T> T get(Class<T> type, T defaultService) {
134                T ret = get(type);
135                return ret == null ? defaultService : ret;              
136        }
137        
138        /**
139         * @param <T> Service type.
140         * @param type Service type class.
141         * @param computer FunctionFactory to compute a service instance if none is found in the context.
142         * @return Service of a particular type or a service returned by the computer if not service of requested type is found in the context. Multiple service instances maybe obtained by passing an array type.
143         */
144        default <T> T get(Class<T> type, Function<Class<T>,T> computer) {
145                T ret = get(type);
146                return ret == null ? computer.apply(type) : ret;                
147        }
148        
149        /**
150         * @param <T> Service type.
151         * @param type Service type class.
152         * @param predicate Service predicate (filter).
153         * @return Service of a particular type. Multiple service instances maybe obtained by passing an array type. To filter multiple instances use Predicate&lt;Object&gt; for
154         * compatibility with both array and component types. 
155         */
156        default <T> T get(Class<T> type, Predicate<? super T> predicate) {
157                T ret = get(type);
158                return predicate == null || predicate.test(ret) ? ret : null;
159        };
160        
161        /**
162         * @param <T> Service type.
163         * @param type Service type class.
164         * @param predicate Service predicate (filter).
165         * @param defaultService Default service implementation to return if no service is found. 
166         * @return Service of a particular type. Multiple service instances maybe obtained by passing an array type. To filter multiple instances use Predicate&lt;Object&gt; for
167         * compatibility with both array and component types. 
168         */
169        default <T> T get(Class<T> type, Predicate<? super T> predicate, T defaultService) {
170                T ret = get(type, predicate);
171                return ret == null ? defaultService : ret;              
172        }
173        
174        /**
175         * @param <T> Service type.
176         * @param type Service type class.
177         * @param predicate Service predicate (filter).
178         * @param computer FunctionFactory to compute a service instance if none is found in the context.
179         * @return Service of a particular type. Multiple service instances maybe obtained by passing an array type. To filter multiple instances use Predicate&lt;Object&gt; for
180         * compatibility with both array and component types. 
181         */
182        default <T> T get(Class<T> type, Predicate<? super T> predicate, Function<Class<T>,T> computer) {
183                T ret = get(type, predicate);
184                return ret == null ? computer.apply(type) : ret;                
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Returns a property converted to the requested type. E.g. property which is a {@link File} or {@link URL} may be converted to {@link InputStream}, {@link Reader} or {@link String}.
189         * The default implementation looks up {@link Converter} service to convert the value returned by <code>get(String)</code> to requested type and falls-back to {@link DefaultConverter}.INSTANCE
190         * if the converter service is not present in the context.
191         * @param <T> Property type.
192         * @param key Object key (property/service name).
193         * @param type Property type class.
194         * @return Property by key converted to requested type. 
195         */
196        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
197        default <T> T get(String key, Class<T> type) {
198                Object prop = get(key);
199                if (type == null || type.isInstance(prop)) {
200                        return (T) prop;
201                }
202                return get(Converter.class, DefaultConverter.INSTANCE).convert(prop, type);
203        }
204        
205        /**
206         * Returns a property converted to the requested type. E.g. property which is a {@link File} or {@link URL} may be converted to {@link InputStream}, {@link Reader} or {@link String}.
207         * The default implementation looks up {@link Converter} service to convert the value returned by <code>get(String)</code> to requested type and falls-back to {@link DefaultConverter}.INSTANCE
208         * if the converter service is not present in the context.
209         * @param <T> Property/service type.
210         * @param key Object key (property/service name).
211         * @param type Property/service type class.
212         * @param defaultValue Default property value. 
213         * @return Property by key converted to requested type or default value if property is not found. 
214         */
215        default <T> T get(String key, Class<T> type, T defaultValue) {
216                T ret = get(key, type);
217                return ret == null ? defaultValue : ret;                
218        }
219        
220        /**
221         * Returns a property converted to the requested type. E.g. property which is a {@link File} or {@link URL} may be converted to {@link InputStream}, {@link Reader} or {@link String}.
222         * The default implementation looks up {@link Converter} service to convert the value returned by <code>get(String)</code> to requested type and falls-back to {@link DefaultConverter}.INSTANCE
223         * if the converter service is not present in the context.
224         * @param <T> Property/service type.
225         * @param key Object key (property/service name).
226         * @param type Property/service type class.
227         * @param computer FunctionFactory to compute property value if none is found in the context.
228         * @return Property by key converted to requested type or computed value if property is not present. 
229         */
230        default <T> T get(String key, Class<T> type, BiFunction<String,Class<T>,T> computer)  {
231                T ret = get(key, type);
232                return ret == null ? computer.apply(key, type) : ret;           
233        }
234        
235        /**
236         * Mounts a context under a specified prefix. get(String) and get(String,Class) methods look up property/source in the mounted context first if the key start with the prefix, removing the prefix.
237         * E.g. if the prefix is <code>resources/</code> then <code>get("resources/myResource")</code> will call <code>get("myResource")</code> in the mounted resource first and will return a value if it is not null.
238         * If the value returned by the mounted context is null, then the value from <code>get("resources/myResource")</code> call to this context will be returned.
239         * In other words, the mounted value shadows this context value, but doesn't hide it.
240         * Typed service calls are always made against this context.
241         * @param context Context to mount.
242         * @param prefix Mount prefix.
243         * @return This context if argument context or argument prefix are null null or a context which delegates get(String) and get(String,Class) to the mounted context if the key start with the prefix. 
244         */
245        default Context mount(Context context, String prefix) {
246                if (context == null || prefix == null) {
247                        return this;
248                }
249                
250                return new Context() {
251
252                        @Override
253                        public Object get(String key) {
254                                if (key != null && key.startsWith(prefix)) {
255                                        Object ret = context.get(key.substring(prefix.length()));
256                                        if (ret != null) {
257                                                return ret;
258                                        }
259                                }
260                                return Context.this.get(key);
261                        }
262
263                        @Override
264                        public <T> T get(Class<T> type) {
265                                return Context.this.get(type);
266                        }
267
268                        @Override
269                        public <T> T get(String key, Class<T> type) {
270                                if (key != null && key.startsWith(prefix)) {
271                                        T ret = context.get(key.substring(prefix.length()), type);
272                                        if (ret != null) {
273                                                return ret;
274                                        }
275                                }
276                                return Context.this.get(key, type);
277                        }
278                        
279                };
280        }
281        
282        /**
283         * @param mapper Key mapping function. 
284         * @return A context which maps the key using the mapper function in <code>get(String></code> and <code>get(String,Class)</code> methods. Returns this context if mapper is null.
285         */
286        default Context map(Function<String,String> mapper) {
287                if (mapper == null) {
288                        return this;
289                }
290                
291                return new Context() {
292
293                        @Override
294                        public Object get(String key) {
295                                return Context.this.get(mapper.apply(key));
296                        }
297
298                        @Override
299                        public <T> T get(Class<T> type) {
300                                return Context.this.get(type);
301                        }
302
303                        @Override
304                        public <T> T get(String key, Class<T> type) {
305                                return Context.this.get(mapper.apply(key), type);
306                        }
307                        
308                };
309        }
310        
311        /**
312         * Returns this context if other is null, or a new context which delegates to this context and falls back to the other if property/service is not found in this context.
313         * @param chain
314         */
315        default Context compose(Context other) {
316                if (other == null) {
317                        return this;
318                }
319                
320                Context[] chain = {this, other};
321                
322                return new Context() {
323                        
324                        @Override
325                        public <T> T get(Class<T> type) {
326                                for (Context ce: chain) {
327                                        if (ce != null) {
328                                                T ret = ce.get(type);
329                                                if (ret != null) {
330                                                        return ret;
331                                                }
332                                        }
333                                }
334                                return null;
335                        }
336                                                
337                        @Override
338                        public <T> T get(Class<T> type, Predicate<? super T> predicate) {
339                                for (Context ce: chain) {
340                                        if (ce != null) {
341                                                T ret = ce.get(type, predicate);
342                                                if (ret != null) {
343                                                        return ret;
344                                                }
345                                        }
346                                }
347                                return null;
348                        }                       
349                        
350                        @Override
351                        public Object get(String key) {
352                                for (Context ce: chain) {
353                                        if (ce != null) {
354                                                Object ret = ce.get(key);
355                                                if (ret != null) {
356                                                        return ret;
357                                                }
358                                        }
359                                }
360                                return null;
361                        }
362                        
363                        @Override
364                        public <T> T get(String key, Class<T> type) {
365                                for (Context ce: chain) {
366                                        if (ce != null) {
367                                                T ret = ce.get(key, type);
368                                                if (ret != null) {
369                                                        return ret;
370                                                }
371                                        }
372                                }
373                                return null;
374                        }
375                                                
376                };
377        }
378        
379        /**
380         * Creates a new mutable context backed by this context.
381         * This call is equivalent to ``fork(null,null)``.
382         * @return
383         */
384        default MutableContext fork() {
385                return fork(null,null);
386        }
387        
388        /**
389         * Creates a new mutable context with a given prefix and service predicate. 
390         * @param mapper Mapper functions, the same as in map();
391         * @param servicePredicate Predicate to use during look up of parent services. One possible scenario is to filter-out {@link Composeable} services from the parent.
392         * @return
393         */
394        default MutableContext fork(Function<String,String> mapper, Predicate<Object> servicePredicate) {
395                Context mapped = map(mapper);
396                if (servicePredicate == null) {
397                        return new SimpleMutableContext(mapped);
398                }
399                Context predicated = new Context() {
400                        
401                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
402                        @Override
403                        public <T> T get(Class<T> type) {
404                                T ret = mapped.get(type);
405                                if (ret == null) {
406                                        return null;
407                                }
408                                if (ret.getClass().isArray()) {
409                                        List<Object> filtered = new ArrayList<Object>(); 
410                                        for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(ret); ++i) {
411                                                Object service = Array.get(ret, i);
412                                                if (servicePredicate.test(service)) {
413                                                        filtered.add(service);
414                                                }
415                                        }
416                                        ret = (T) filtered.toArray((Object[]) Array.newInstance(ret.getClass().getComponentType(), filtered.size()));
417                                }
418                                return servicePredicate.test(ret) ? null : ret;
419                        }
420                        
421                        @Override
422                        public Object get(String key) {
423                                return mapped.get(key);
424                        }
425                };
426                return new SimpleMutableContext(predicated);
427        }
428                
429        static Pattern EXPANDER_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\$\\{(.+?)\\}");    
430        
431        /**
432         * Expands tokens in the form of ``${token name|default value}`` to their values.
433         * If a token is not found the default value after the pipe is used for expansion.
434         * If there is no default value then the expansion is not processed. Token names shall not contain pipes.
435         * If replacement is not null and there is a {@link Converter} service then the converter is used 
436         * to convert the replacement to {@link String}. If no such conversion can be done then toString() is used 
437         * as default conversion. Add extra open/closing curly brackets to escape the token, e.g. in documentation. 
438         * For example <code>${{xyz}}</code> will be "interpolated" as <code>${xyz}</code>. There may be multiple levels of curly brackets.
439         * This behavior may be leveraged in multi-stage interpolation where early stage interpolators "peel" the token until it comes at the interpolation level where it is supposed to be expanded.    
440         * @param input
441         * @return If the string contains just a single token then the token value is returned as-is. Otherwise tokens in the input are replaced with their values converted to string using context {@link Converter} service if it is present or toString() method.
442         */
443        default Object interpolate(String input) {
444                if (input == null) {
445                        return input;
446                }
447                
448                // Computing properties.
449                Context tokenComputer = computingContext();
450                
451                Matcher matcher = EXPANDER_PATTERN.matcher(input);
452                StringBuilder output = new StringBuilder();
453                int i = 0;
454                while (matcher.find()) {
455                    String token = matcher.group();
456                    String peeledToken = token.substring(2, token.length()-1); // Peeling of ${ and }
457                    if (peeledToken.startsWith("{") && input.length() > matcher.end() && '}' == input.charAt(matcher.end())) {
458                            output
459                                .append(input.substring(i, matcher.start() + 2))
460                                .append(peeledToken.substring(1));
461                            i = matcher.end();
462                    } else {
463                            int pipeIdx = peeledToken.indexOf('|');
464                            String defaultValue = pipeIdx == -1 ? null : peeledToken.substring(pipeIdx + 1);
465                            if (pipeIdx != -1) {
466                                peeledToken = peeledToken.substring(0, pipeIdx);
467                            }
468                            
469                        if (matcher.start() == 0 && matcher.end() == input.length()) {
470                                Object replacement = tokenComputer.get(peeledToken, defaultValue);
471                                        return replacement == null ? input : replacement;
472                        }
473                            
474                                Object replacement = tokenComputer.getString(peeledToken, defaultValue);
475                            if (replacement != null) {
476                                if (!(replacement instanceof String)) {
477                                        Converter converter = get(Converter.class);
478                                        if (converter != null) {
479                                                String str = converter.convert(replacement, String.class);
480                                                if (str != null) {
481                                                        replacement = str;
482                                                }
483                                        }
484                                }
485                                    output.append(input.substring(i, matcher.start())).append(replacement);                         
486                                    i = matcher.end();
487                            }
488                    }
489                }
490                output.append(input.substring(i, input.length()));
491                return output.toString();
492        }
493        
494        /**
495         * Interpolates to {@link String}.
496         * @param input
497         * @return
498         */
499        default String interpolateToString(String input) {
500                Object result = interpolate(input);
501                if (result == null) {
502                        return null;
503                }
504                if (result instanceof String) {
505                        return (String) result;
506                }
507        Converter converter = get(Converter.class);
508        if (converter != null) {
509                String str = converter.convert(result, String.class);
510                if (str != null) {
511                        return str;
512                }
513        }               
514        return String.valueOf(result);
515        }
516        
517        /**
518         * Creates a copy of this map using {@link LinkedHashMap} with {@link String} values interpolated and
519         * {@link Map} and {@link Collection} values passed through interpolate methods with respective parameter types.
520         * @param input
521         * @return A deep copy of the map with string values interpolated.
522         */
523        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
524        default <K> Map<K,Object> interpolate(Map<K,?> input) {
525                if (input == null) {
526                        return null;
527                }
528                Map<K,Object> ret = new LinkedHashMap<>();
529                input.forEach((k,v) -> {
530                        Object u;
531                        if (v instanceof String) {
532                                u = interpolate((String) v);
533                        } else if (v instanceof Collection) {
534                                u = interpolate((Collection<Object>) v);
535                        } else if (v instanceof Map) {
536                                u = interpolate((Map<K,Object>) v);
537                        } else {
538                                u = v;
539                        }
540                        ret.put(k,u);
541                });
542                return ret;
543        }
544        
545        /**
546         * Creates a copy of this map using {@link ArrayList} with {@link String} values interpolated and
547         * {@link Map} and {@link Collection} values passed through interpolate methods with respective parameter types.
548         * @param input
549         * @return A deep copy of the collection with string values interpolated.
550         */
551        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
552        default List<Object> interpolate(Collection<?> input) {
553                if (input == null) {
554                        return null;
555                }
556                List<Object> ret = new ArrayList<>();
557                input.forEach(v -> {
558                        Object u;
559                        if (v instanceof String) {
560                                u = interpolate((String) v);
561                        } else if (v instanceof Collection) {
562                                u = interpolate((Collection<Object>) v);
563                        } else if (v instanceof Map) {
564                                u = interpolate((Map<Object,Object>) v);
565                        } else {
566                                u = v;
567                        }
568                        ret.add(u);
569                });
570                return ret;
571                
572        }
573        
574        /**
575         * @return A context backed by this context which caches values of propeties by key and of services by type.
576         */     
577        default Context cachingContext() {
578                
579                return new Context() {
580                        
581                        private Map<String, Optional<Object>> properties = new HashMap<>();
582                        private Map<Class<?>, Optional<Object>> services = new HashMap<>();
583                        
584                        
585                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
586                        @Override
587                        public <T> T get(Class<T> type) {
588                                Optional<Object> sopt = services.computeIfAbsent(type, (theType) -> Optional.ofNullable(Context.this.get(theType)));
589                                return sopt.isPresent() ? (T) sopt.get() : null;
590                        }
591                        
592                        @Override
593                        public Object get(String key) {
594                                Optional<Object> popt = properties.computeIfAbsent(key, (theKey) -> Optional.ofNullable(Context.this.get(theKey)));
595                                return popt.isPresent() ? popt.get() : null;
596                        }
597                        
598                };
599                                
600        }
601        
602        /**
603         * Computing context retrieves properties from this context. If a property is found and is of {@link PropertyComputer} type, then the property computer is
604         * invoked to produce value otherwise the value is returned as is. If a property for a given key is not found, the computer traverses the key hierarchy up. Slash (/) is 
605         * a key separator. When it finds a parent property value then is computes the property value in the following way - for a property computer its compute() method is invoked,
606         * for {@link Context} the path from the parent property is used to retrieve value, for {@link Map} its get method is used, for {@link List} an element is retrived if key path is parseable to int,  
607         * for {@link Function} the path is passed to it as an argument and the value is returned as property value. 
608         * @return 
609         */
610        default Context computingContext() {
611                
612                return new Context() {
613
614                        @Override
615                        public Object get(String key) {
616                                return get(key, Object.class);
617                        }
618
619                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
620                        @Override
621                        public <T> T get(String key, Class<T> type) {
622                                Object value = Context.this.get(key, (Class<?>) null);
623                                
624                                if (value instanceof PropertyComputer) {
625                                        return ((PropertyComputer) value).compute(this, key, null, type);
626                                }
627                                
628                                if (value instanceof Function) {
629                                        return ((Function<Context, T>) value).apply(this);
630                                }
631                                
632                                if (value instanceof BiFunction) {
633                                        return ((BiFunction<Context, Class<?>, T>) value).apply(this, type);
634                                }                                                                                                       
635                                
636                                T ret = Context.this.get(key, type);
637                                
638                                // At the spot computing of the property itself
639                                
640                                return ret == null ? computeByParent(key, null, type) : ret;
641                        }
642                        
643                        /**
644                         * Computes value by walking up the property key path.
645                         * @param <T>
646                         * @param key Current path
647                         * @param path Key path after the key
648                         * @param type
649                         * @return
650                         */
651                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
652                        private <T> T computeByParent(String key, String path, Class<T> type) {                         
653                                Converter converter;
654                                if (type == null || type == Object.class) {
655                                        converter = new Converter() {
656                                                
657                                                @Override
658                                                public <TP> TP convert(Object source, Class<TP> type) {
659                                                        return (TP) source;
660                                                }
661                                        };  
662                                } else {
663                                        converter = get(Converter.class, DefaultConverter.INSTANCE);
664                                }
665                                
666                                int lastSlash = key.lastIndexOf('/');
667                                if (lastSlash == -1) {
668                                        return null;
669                                }
670                                
671                                String parentKey = key.substring(0, lastSlash);
672                                String subKey = key.substring(lastSlash + 1);
673                                if (path != null) {
674                                        subKey += "/" + path;
675                                }
676                                Object parentProperty = Context.this.get(parentKey);
677                                if (parentProperty instanceof PropertyComputer) {
678                                        return ((PropertyComputer) parentProperty).compute(this,  parentKey, subKey, type);
679                                }
680                                
681                                if (parentProperty instanceof Context) {
682                                        return ((Context) parentProperty).get(subKey, type);    
683                                }
684                                if (parentProperty instanceof Map) {
685                                        return converter.convert(((Map<?,?>) parentProperty).get(subKey), type);
686                                }
687                                if (parentProperty instanceof List) {
688                                        try {
689                                                int idx = Integer.parseInt(subKey);
690                                                if (idx >= 0 && idx < ((List<?>) parentProperty).size()) {
691                                                        return converter.convert(((List<?>) parentProperty).get(idx), type);
692                                                }
693                                        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
694                                                // NOP
695                                        }
696                                }
697                                if (parentProperty instanceof Function) {
698                                        return converter.convert(((Function<String, Object>) parentProperty).apply(subKey), type);
699                                }
700
701                                return computeByParent(parentKey, subKey, type);
702                        }
703
704                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
705                        @Override
706                        public <T> T get(Class<T> type) {
707                                T svc = Context.this.get(type);
708                                if (svc instanceof ServiceComputer) {
709                                        return ((ServiceComputer<T>) svc).compute(this, type);
710                                }
711                                if (svc != null) {
712                                        return svc;
713                                }
714                                for (Field f: type.getFields()) {
715                                        if ("INSTANCE".equals(f.getName()) && Modifier.isStatic(f.getModifiers()) && type.isAssignableFrom(f.getType())) {
716                                                try {
717                                                        return (T) f.get(null);
718                                                } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
719                                                        throw new NasdanikaException("Error accessing INSTANCE field of " + type.getName(), e);
720                                                }
721                                        }
722                                }
723                                return null;                            
724                        }
725                        
726                        @Override
727                        public String toString() {
728                                return "Computing context " + super.toString();
729                        }
730                        
731                };
732        }
733        
734        /**
735         * Creates a context with a single service entry.
736         * @param key
737         * @param value
738         * @return
739         */
740        static <T> Context singleton(Class<T> type, T service) {
741                return new Context() {
742
743                        @Override
744                        public Object get(String key) {
745                                return null;
746                        }
747
748                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
749                        @Override
750                        public <ST> ST get(Class<ST> sType) {
751                                Object ret = sType == type ? service : null;
752                                return (ST) ret;
753                        }
754                        
755                };
756        }       
757        
758        /**
759         * Creates a context with a single property entry.
760         * @param key
761         * @param value
762         * @return
763         */
764        static Context singleton(String key, Object value) {    
765                return wrap(k -> key.equals(k) ? value : null);
766        }
767
768        /**
769         * Wraps a source function, e.g. Map<String,Object>::get into a context. Performs resolution of hierarchical properties.
770         * @param source Source function.
771         * @return
772         */
773        static Context wrap(Function<String,Object> source) {
774                return new Context() {
775
776                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
777                        @Override
778                        public Object get(String key) {
779                                Object ret = source.apply(key);
780                                if (ret != null) {
781                                        return ret;
782                                }
783                                
784                                int lastSlash = key.lastIndexOf('/');
785                                if (lastSlash == -1) {
786                                        return null;
787                                }
788                                
789                                Object parentProperty = get(key.substring(0, lastSlash));
790                                String subKey = key.substring(lastSlash + 1);
791                                if (parentProperty instanceof Context) {
792                                        return ((Context) parentProperty).get(subKey);  
793                                }
794                                if (parentProperty instanceof Map) {
795                                        return ((Map<?,?>) parentProperty).get(subKey);
796                                }
797                                if (parentProperty instanceof List) {
798                                        try {
799                                                int idx = Integer.parseInt(subKey);
800                                                if (idx >= 0 && idx < ((List<?>) parentProperty).size()) {
801                                                        return ((List<?>) parentProperty).get(idx);
802                                                }
803                                        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
804                                                // NOP
805                                        }
806                                }
807                                if (parentProperty instanceof Function) {
808                                        return ((Function<String, Object>) parentProperty).apply(subKey);
809                                }
810
811                                return null;
812                        }
813
814                        @Override
815                        public <T> T get(Class<T> type) {
816                                return null;
817                        }
818                        
819                };
820        }       
821        
822}
